page.title: 04Butteryhaugh Viaduct
page.content: At the northern end of the{Bakethin {Reservoir}may be seen the most striking{Butteryhaugh Viaduct.}Until 1956 the viaduct carried the line which was opened in 1862 as the Border Counties railway. The railway was built to assist in the movement of coal from the collieries in the Upper Tyne Valley north onto Scotland. To the south the line extended to{Hexham}. The route of the railway can be seen clearly as it passes through cuttings and over embankments to the north of Kielder village, following Deadwater Burn.
